  "description": "Citibank Nigeria Limited (CNL) was incorporated in Nigeria on May 2, 1984 and the oldest international bank in the country. It provides a wide range of financial products and services to corporate and commercial customers, financial institutions and public sector organizations. It offers deposit and loan products, global transaction services, cash management, sales and trading, corporate finance and investment banking products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Trading Desk Officer&nbsp;

Job Req ID:&nbsp;25916162
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: On-Site/Resident

Job Summary


	Are you looking for a career move that will put you at the heart of a global financial institution? Then bring your skills in Trading, risk management and communication to Citi&rsquo;s Global Rates Team.
	By Joining Citi, you will become part of a global organisation whose mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress.
	The Trader is an intermediate level position responsible for assisting with a trading book and mitigating risk, in coordination with the Trading team.
	The overall objective of this role is to process trades for a trading book and achieve revenue targets.


What you&rsquo;ll do


	Operate in an efficient trading team, providing continual feedback that affects internal mobility and training.
	Run a business plan with objectives aligned to global targets while optimizing resource allocation
	Operate and manage the risk and trading infrastructure, including portfolio risk, and ensure risks are correctly represented
	Coordinate with control functions to ensure governance and control infrastructure is in place, and communication with regulators is productive
	Manage the technological development of the trading desk operation
	Leading strong governance and controls:
	Work in close partnership with control functions such as Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure
	Operate in a culture of responsible finance, good governance , expense discipline and ethics
	Appropriately assess risk/reward of transactions when making business decisions; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same, demonstrating proper consideration for the firm&rsquo;s reputation.
	Be familiar with and adhere to Citi&rsquo;s Code of Conduct and the Plan of Supervision for Global Markets and Securities Services; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same
	Adhere to all policies and procedures as defined by your role which will be communicated to you
	Obtain and maintain all registrations/licenses which are required for your role, within the appropriate timeframe
	Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm&#39;s reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.


What we&rsquo;ll need from you


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree/University degree or equivalent experience
	Candidates must also have a minimum of 5 years of postgraduation experience. &nbsp;
	Master&rsquo;s degree preferred
	A minimum of first degree or its equivalent in any discipline, plus a relevant higher degree or professional qualification.
	Required licensing and registrations as applicable preferred
	In-depth knowledge of respective products and clients
	Proven history of successful trading book management
	Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication.

Trading Desk Officer Job at Citibank Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Citibank Nigeria Limited (CNL) was incorporated in Nigeria on May 2, 1984 and the oldest international bank in the country. It provides a wide range of financial products and services to corporate and commercial customers, financial institutions and public sector organizations. It offers deposit and loan products, global transaction services, cash management, sales and trading, corporate finance and investment banking products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Trading Desk Officer 

Job Req ID: 25916162
Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: On-Site/Resident

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you looking for a career move that will put you at the heart of a global financial institution? Then bring your skills in Trading, risk management and communication to Citi’s Global Rates Team.
	By Joining Citi, you will become part of a global organisation whose mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress.
	The Trader is an intermediate level position responsible for assisting with a trading book and mitigating risk, in coordination with the Trading team.
	The overall objective of this role is to process trades for a trading book and achieve revenue targets.


What you’ll do


	Operate in an efficient trading team, providing continual feedback that affects internal mobility and training.
	Run a business plan with objectives aligned to global targets while optimizing resource allocation
	Operate and manage the risk and trading infrastructure, including portfolio risk, and ensure risks are correctly represented
	Coordinate with control functions to ensure governance and control infrastructure is in place, and communication with regulators is productive
	Manage the technological development of the trading desk operation
	Leading strong governance and controls:
	Work in close partnership with control functions such as Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure
	Operate in a culture of responsible finance, good governance , expense discipline and ethics
	Appropriately assess risk/reward of transactions when making business decisions; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same, demonstrating proper consideration for the firm’s reputation.
	Be familiar with and adhere to Citi’s Code of Conduct and the Plan of Supervision for Global Markets and Securities Services; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same
	Adhere to all policies and procedures as defined by your role which will be communicated to you
	Obtain and maintain all registrations/licenses which are required for your role, within the appropriate timeframe
	Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.


What we’ll need from you


	Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience
	Candidates must also have a minimum of 5 years of postgraduation experience.  
	Master’s degree preferred
	A minimum of first degree or its equivalent in any discipline, plus a relevant higher degree or professional qualification.
	Required licensing and registrations as applicable preferred
	In-depth knowledge of respective products and clients
	Proven history of successful trading book management
	Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication.

Job Responsibilities


	Build and own a rolling 3&ndash;6?month supply plan (volumes by product/grade, by source/depot/terminal) aligned to sales forecast, inventory policies, and turnaround schedules.
	Run monthly reports with Sales/Finance/Operations; reconcile demand signals, constraints, and supply scenarios (base/optimistic/constrained).
	Evaluate and recommend sourcing options (local vs. import, index vs. fixed, cargo parcelization) to achieve optimal netback/landed cost.
	Support negotiation of spot/term supply contracts, pricing formulas (e.g., Platts + premium), and service level provisions (incoterms, laytime, demurrage caps).
	Optimize truck turn?around times (TTT), transport allocation, and route planning to reduce stock?outs and secondary distribution cost.
	Interface daily with depots/tank farms and transporters; resolve dispatch issues, prioritize critical stations/customers, and communicate ETAs.
	Monitor stock levels, ullage, and in?transit quantities across locations; trigger replenishment per policy.
	Lead daily/weekly reconciliations (book vs. physical, terminal loss/gain), variance analyses, and corrective actions.

	7 &ndash; 10&nbsp;years in downstream oil &amp; gas supply, distribution, trading support, or terminal operations; proven experience with marine / truck scheduling and inventory control in multi?depot networks.

Supply Manager Job at Fadac Resources and Services Limited




        
    

        
        Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our client, a group of companies in Nigeria, is due to expansion, recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Build and own a rolling 3–6?month supply plan (volumes by product/grade, by source/depot/terminal) aligned to sales forecast, inventory policies, and turnaround schedules.
	Run monthly reports with Sales/Finance/Operations; reconcile demand signals, constraints, and supply scenarios (base/optimistic/constrained).
	Evaluate and recommend sourcing options (local vs. import, index vs. fixed, cargo parcelization) to achieve optimal netback/landed cost.
	Support negotiation of spot/term supply contracts, pricing formulas (e.g., Platts + premium), and service level provisions (incoterms, laytime, demurrage caps).
	Optimize truck turn?around times (TTT), transport allocation, and route planning to reduce stock?outs and secondary distribution cost.
	Interface daily with depots/tank farms and transporters; resolve dispatch issues, prioritize critical stations/customers, and communicate ETAs.
	Monitor stock levels, ullage, and in?transit quantities across locations; trigger replenishment per policy.
	Lead daily/weekly reconciliations (book vs. physical, terminal loss/gain), variance analyses, and corrective actions.
	Ensure all importation/local supply activities meet regulatory requirements (permits, DPR/NMDPRA approvals, SONCAP where applicable).
	Liaise with inspection agencies and regulators; prepare responses for audits and ensure adherence to HSE, weights & measures, and tax rules.
	Track landed cost drivers (premiums, freight, demurrage, storage, handling, throughput, transport, losses)
	and implement savings initiatives.
	Reduce demurrage and detention through proactive laytime management and slot optimization; escalate port/depot constraints early.
	Maintain supplier and transporter performance KPIs; drive corrective actions or re?tendering as needed.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Supply Chain/Logistics, Economics, or related field.
	7 – 10 years in downstream oil & gas supply, distribution, trading support, or terminal operations; proven experience with marine / truck scheduling and inventory control in multi?depot networks.
	Master’s Degree/MBA is an advantage.
	Working knowledge of ERP (e.g., SAP/Oracle/Microsoft Dynamics), TMS, terminal automation systems, and advanced Excel/analytics.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: susan.o@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Job Overview


	Our client is seeking a highly experienced Creative Assistant who will be working directly with the Founder and other key teams to contribute to and execute the brand&#39;s creative vision.
	This position requires a proactive and strategic individual who can translate market insights into actionable plans.
	The ideal candidate will work hand-in-hand with our production and social media teams to ensure that every design, product, and marketing campaign is cohesive and effectively represents our brand.


Key Responsibilities
Creative and Brand Development:


	Proactively analyse and understand our brand&#39;s core aesthetic and future direction to independently develop new collection concepts and proposals.
	Contribute to the strategic direction of the brand by conducting in-depth research on emerging fashion trends and competitor activities.
	Present compelling creative concepts, including mood boards, colour palettes, and material selections, for brainstorming sessions and review.
	Ensure all designs and brand-related materials are aligned with our unique brand voice, maintaining a consistent and cohesive image.
	Design &amp; Production Execution:
	Work closely with the production team to translate creative concepts into actionable production plans, ensuring meticulous craftsmanship and quality.
	Supervise the end-to-end production process for designs, from initial prototype to final garment, ensuring a seamless transition and adherence to design specifications.
	Troubleshoot and resolve any production challenges in partnership with the production team to maintain project timelines and quality standards.


Marketing &amp; Visual Communication:


	Collaborate with the social media team to develop and execute marketing strategies that effectively launch and promote new collections.
	Contribute to the creation of all creative content for digital platforms (e.g., website, social media, email newsletters), ensuring it is on-brand and engaging.
	Assist in coordinating and executing photoshoots and marketing campaigns, managing logistics, and on-set direction to achieve the desired visual outcome.


Administrative &amp; Operational Support:


	Provide comprehensive administrative support to the founder, including calendar management, correspondence, and project coordination.
	Act as a key point of contact for external collaborators, ensuring smooth communication and project flow.



	Demonstrate a high level of independent initiative by anticipating needs and proactively taking on tasks to support the brand&#39;s growth and daily operations.


Qualifications


	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in a relevant field.
	Experience:&nbsp;2 - 4 years of proven experience in a creative or marketing role, preferably within the fashion or luxury goods industry.
	A strong portfolio demonstrating a clear creative vision and understanding of brand building.
	Exceptional strategic and critical thinking skills, with the ability to turn abstract ideas into concrete, actionable plans.
	Proficiency in design and editing software.
	Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	A proactive, self-motivated individual who thrives in a fast paced, collaborative environment.
	The ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines with precision.


Salary

	Ensure all designs and brand-related materials are aligned with our unique brand voice, maintaining a consistent and cohesive image.
	Design & Production Execution:
	Work closely with the production team to translate creative concepts into actionable production plans, ensuring meticulous craftsmanship and quality.
	Supervise the end-to-end production process for designs, from initial prototype to final garment, ensuring a seamless transition and adherence to design specifications.
	Troubleshoot and resolve any production challenges in partnership with the production team to maintain project timelines and quality standards.


Marketing & Visual Communication:


	Collaborate with the social media team to develop and execute marketing strategies that effectively launch and promote new collections.
	Contribute to the creation of all creative content for digital platforms (e.g., website, social media, email newsletters), ensuring it is on-brand and engaging.
	Assist in coordinating and executing photoshoots and marketing campaigns, managing logistics, and on-set direction to achieve the desired visual outcome.


Administrative & Operational Support:


	Provide comprehensive administrative support to the founder, including calendar management, correspondence, and project coordination.
	Act as a key point of contact for external collaborators, ensuring smooth communication and project flow.



	Demonstrate a high level of independent initiative by anticipating needs and proactively taking on tasks to support the brand's growth and daily operations.

	Experience: 2 - 4 years of proven experience in a creative or marketing role, preferably within the fashion or luxury goods industry.
	A strong portfolio demonstrating a clear creative vision and understanding of brand building.
	Exceptional strategic and critical thinking skills, with the ability to turn abstract ideas into concrete, actionable plans.
	Proficiency in design and editing software.
	Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	A proactive, self-motivated individual who thrives in a fast paced, collaborative environment.
	The ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines with precision.
